pageProps.content: [["$r","MaxWidth","last",{"children":[["$r","p",null,{"children":["Most props on a JSX element are passed on to the component, however, there are two special props (",["$r","code",null,{"children":"ref"}]," and ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"key"}],") which are used by React, and are thus not forwarded to the component."]}],"\n",["$r","p",null,{"children":["For instance, you can’t read ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"props.key"}]," from a component. If you need to access the same value within the child component, you should pass it as a different prop (ex: ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"<ListItemWrapper key={result.id} id={result.id} />"}]," and read ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"props.id"}],"). While this may seem redundant, it’s important to separate app logic from hints to React."]}]]}]]
